name: azuread
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing azuread cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`azuread` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-azuread).

allowedMemberTypes.description: Specifies whether this app role definition can be assigned to users and groups by setting to `User`, or to other applications (that are accessing this application in daemon service scenarios) by setting to `Application`, or to both.

description.description: Permission help text that appears in the admin app assignment and consent experiences.

displayName.description: Display name for the permission that appears in the admin consent and app assignment experiences.

isEnabled.description: Determines if the permission is enabled: defaults to `true`.

value.description: The value of the scope claim that the resource application should expect in the OAuth 2.0 access token.

adminConsentDescription.description: Permission help text that appears in the admin consent and app assignment experiences.

adminConsentDisplayName.description: Display name for the permission that appears in the admin consent and app assignment experiences.

id.description: The unique identifier for one of the `OAuth2Permission` or `AppRole` instances that the resource application exposes.

isEnabled.description: Determines if the app role is enabled: Defaults to `true`.

type.description: Type of an application: `webapp/api` or `native`. Defaults to `webapp/api`. For `native` apps type `identifier_uris` property can not not be set.

userConsentDescription.description: Permission help text that appears in the end user consent experience.

userConsentDisplayName.description: Display name for the permission that appears in the end user consent experience.

value.description: Specifies the value of the roles claim that the application should expect in the authentication and access tokens.

additionalProperties.description: List of Additional Properties of the claim. If a property exists in this list, it modifies the behaviour of the optional claim.

essential.description: Whether the claim specified by the client is necessary to ensure a smooth authorization experience.

name.description: The name of the optional claim.

source.description: The source of the claim. If `source` is absent, the claim is a predefined optional claim. If `source` is `user`, the value of `name` is the extension property from the user object.

additionalProperties.description: List of Additional Properties of the claim. If a property exists in this list, it modifies the behaviour of the optional claim.

essential.description: Whether the claim specified by the client is necessary to ensure a smooth authorization experience.

name.description: The display name for the application.

source.description: The source of the claim. If `source` is absent, the claim is a predefined optional claim. If `source` is `user`, the value of `name` is the extension property from the user object.

resourceAccesses.description: A collection of `resource_access` blocks as documented below.

resourceAppId.description: The unique identifier for the resource that the application requires access to. This should be equal to the appId declared on the target resource application.

id.description: The unique identifier for one of the `OAuth2Permission` or `AppRole` instances that the resource application exposes.

type.description: Specifies whether the id property references an `OAuth2Permission` or an `AppRole`. Possible values are `Scope` or `Role`.

adminConsentDescription.description: The description of the admin consent.

adminConsentDisplayName.description: The display name of the admin consent.

id.description: The unique identifier for one of the `OAuth2Permission`.

userConsentDescription.description: The description of the user consent.

userConsentDisplayName.description: The display name of the user consent.

allowedMemberTypes.description: Specifies whether this app role definition can be assigned to users and groups, or to other applications (that are accessing this application in daemon service scenarios). Possible values are: `User` and `Application`, or both.

description.description: Permission help text that appears in the admin app assignment and consent experiences.

displayName.description: Display name for the permission that appears in the admin consent and app assignment experiences.

isEnabled.description: Determines if the app role is enabled.

value.description: Specifies the value of the roles claim that the application should expect in the authentication and access tokens.

adminConsentDisplayName.description: The display name of the admin consent

userConsentDescription.description: The description of the user consent

userConsentDisplayName.description: The display name of the user consent

value.description: Specifies the value of the roles claim that the application should expect in the authentication and access tokens.

additionalProperties.description: List of Additional Properties of the claim. If a property exists in this list, it modifies the behaviour of the optional claim.

essential.description: Whether the claim specified by the client is necessary to ensure a smooth authorization experience.

name.description: Specifies the name of the Application within Azure Active Directory.

source.description: The source of the claim. If `source` is absent, the claim is a predefined optional claim. If `source` is `user`, the value of `name` is the extension property from the user object.

additionalProperties.description: List of Additional Properties of the claim. If a property exists in this list, it modifies the behaviour of the optional claim.

essential.description: Whether the claim specified by the client is necessary to ensure a smooth authorization experience.

name.description: Specifies the name of the Application within Azure Active Directory.

source.description: The source of the claim. If `source` is absent, the claim is a predefined optional claim. If `source` is `user`, the value of `name` is the extension property from the user object.

resourceAccesses.description: A collection of `resource_access` blocks as documented below

resourceAppId.description: The unique identifier for the resource that the application requires access to.

authenticationType.description: The authentication type of the domain (Managed or Federated).

isDefault.description: `True` if this is the default domain that is used for user creation.

isInitial.description: `True` if this is the initial domain created by Azure Activie Directory.

isVerified.description: `True` if the domain has completed domain ownership verification.

allowedMemberTypes.description: Specifies whether this app role definition can be assigned to users and groups, or to other applications (that are accessing this application in daemon service scenarios). Possible values are: `User` and `Application`, or both.

description.description: Permission help text that appears in the admin app assignment and consent experiences.

displayName.description: The Display Name of the Azure AD Application associated with this Service Principal.

isEnabled.description: Determines if the app role is enabled.

value.description: Specifies the value of the roles claim that the application should expect in the authentication and access tokens.

adminConsentDescription.description: The description of the admin consent

adminConsentDisplayName.description: The display name of the admin consent

isEnabled.description: Determines if the app role is enabled.

userConsentDescription.description: The description of the user consent

userConsentDisplayName.description: The display name of the user consent

value.description: Specifies the value of the roles claim that the application should expect in the authentication and access tokens.

accountEnabled.description: `True` if the account is enabled; otherwise `False`.

displayName.description: The Display Name of the Azure AD User.

immutableId.description: The value used to associate an on-premises Active Directory user account with their Azure AD user object.

mail.description: The primary email address of the Azure AD User.

mailNickname.description: The email alias of the Azure AD User.

onpremisesSamAccountName.description: The on premise sam account name of the Azure AD User.

onpremisesUserPrincipalName.description: The on premise user principal name of the Azure AD User.

usageLocation.description: The usage location of the Azure AD User.

userPrincipalName.description: The User Principal Name of the Azure AD User.

provider.description:
The provider type for the azuread package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

appRoles.description: A collection of `app_role` blocks as documented below. For more information https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/architecture/multitenant-identity/app-roles

availableToOtherTenants.description: Is this Azure AD Application available to other tenants? Defaults to `false`.

groupMembershipClaims.description: Configures the `groups` claim issued in a user or OAuth 2.0 access token that the app expects. Defaults to `SecurityGroup`. Possible values are `None`, `SecurityGroup`, `DirectoryRole`, `ApplicationGroup` or `All`.

homepage.description: The URL to the application's home page. If no homepage is specified this defaults to `https://{name}`.

identifierUris.description: A list of user-defined URI(s) that uniquely identify a Web application within it's Azure AD tenant, or within a verified custom domain if the application is multi-tenant.

logoutUrl.description: The URL of the logout page.

name.description: The display name for the application.

oauth2AllowImplicitFlow.description: Does this Azure AD Application allow OAuth2.0 implicit flow tokens? Defaults to `false`.

oauth2Permissions.description: A collection of OAuth 2.0 permission scopes that the web API (resource) app exposes to client apps. Each permission is covered by `oauth2_permissions` blocks as documented below.

optionalClaims.description: A collection of `access_token` or `id_token` blocks as documented below which list the optional claims configured for each token type. For more information see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/develop/active-directory-optional-claims

owners.description: A list of Azure AD Object IDs that will be granted ownership of the application. Defaults to the Object ID of the caller creating the application. If a list is specified the caller Object ID will no longer be included unless explicitly added to the list.

preventDuplicateNames.description: If `true`, will return an error when an existing Application is found with the same name. Defaults to `false`.

publicClient.description: Is this Azure AD Application a public client? Defaults to `false`.

replyUrls.description: A list of URLs that user tokens are sent to for sign in, or the redirect URIs that OAuth 2.0 authorization codes and access tokens are sent to.

requiredResourceAccesses.description: A collection of `required_resource_access` blocks as documented below.

type.description: Type of an application: `webapp/api` or `native`. Defaults to `webapp/api`. For `native` apps type `identifier_uris` property can not not be set.

applicationObjectId.description: The Object ID of the Application for which this Certificate should be created. Changing this field forces a new resource to be created.

endDate.description: The End Date which the Certificate is valid until, formatted as a RFC3339 date string (e.g. `2018-01-01T01:02:03Z`). Changing this field forces a new resource to be created.

endDateRelative.description: A relative duration for which the Certificate is valid until, for example `240h` (10 days) or `2400h30m`. Changing this field forces a new resource to be created.

keyId.description: A GUID used to uniquely identify this Certificate. If not specified a GUID will be created. Changing this field forces a new resource to be created.

startDate.description: The Start Date which the Certificate is valid from, formatted as a RFC3339 date string (e.g. `2018-01-01T01:02:03Z`). If this isn't specified, the current date is used.  Changing this field forces a new resource to be created.

type.description: The type of key/certificate. Must be one of `AsymmetricX509Cert` or `Symmetric`. Changing this fields forces a new resource to be created.

value.description: The Certificate for this Service Principal.

description.description: The description for the Group.  Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

members.description: A set of members who should be present in this Group. Supported Object types are Users, Groups or Service Principals.

name.description: The display name for the Group. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

owners.description: A set of owners who own this Group. Supported Object types are Users or Service Principals.

preventDuplicateNames.description: If `true`, will return an error when an existing Group is found with the same name. Defaults to `false`.

appRoleAssignmentRequired.description: Does this Service Principal require an AppRoleAssignment to a user or group before Azure AD will issue a user or access token to the application? Defaults to `false`.

applicationId.description: The ID of the Azure AD Application for which to create a Service Principal.

displayName.description: The Display Name of the Azure Active Directory Application associated with this Service Principal.

oauth2Permissions.description: A collection of OAuth 2.0 permissions exposed by the associated application. Each permission is covered by a `oauth2_permission` block as documented below.

tags.description: A list of tags to apply to the Service Principal.

endDateRelative.description: A relative duration for which the Password is valid until, for example `240h` (10 days) or `2400h30m`. Valid time units are "ns", "us" (or "s"), "ms", "s", "m", "h". Changing this field forces a new resource to be created.

keyId.description: A GUID used to uniquely identify this Key. If not specified a GUID will be created. Changing this field forces a new resource to be created.

servicePrincipalId.description: The ID of the Service Principal for which this password should be created. Changing this field forces a new resource to be created.

startDate.description: The Start Date which the Password is valid from, formatted as a RFC3339 date string (e.g. `2018-01-01T01:02:03Z`). If this isn't specified, the current date is used.  Changing this field forces a new resource to be created.

value.description: The Password for this Service Principal.

accountEnabled.description: `true` if the account should be enabled, otherwise `false`. Defaults to `true`.

displayName.description: The name to display in the address book for the user.

forcePasswordChange.description: `true` if the User is forced to change the password during the next sign-in. Defaults to `false`.

immutableId.description: The value used to associate an on-premises Active Directory user account with their Azure AD user object. This must be specified if you are using a federated domain for the user's userPrincipalName (UPN) property when creating a new user account.

mail.description: The primary email address of the Azure AD User.

mailNickname.description: The mail alias for the user. Defaults to the user name part of the User Principal Name.

objectId.description: The Object ID of the Azure AD User.

onpremisesSamAccountName.description: The on premise sam account name of the Azure AD User.

onpremisesUserPrincipalName.description: The on premise user principal name of the Azure AD User.

password.description: The password for the User. The password must satisfy minimum requirements as specified by the password policy. The maximum length is 256 characters.

usageLocation.description: The usage location of the User. Required for users that will be assigned licenses due to legal requirement to check for availability of services in countries. The usage location is a two letter country code (ISO standard 3166). Examples include: `NO`, `JP`, and `GB`. Cannot be reset to null once set.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getApplication.

applicationId.description: Specifies the Application ID of the Azure Active Directory Application.

name.description: Specifies the name of the Application within Azure Active Directory.

oauth2Permissions.description: A collection of OAuth 2.0 permission scopes that the web API (resource) app exposes to client apps. Each permission is covered by a `oauth2_permission` block as documented below.

objectId.description: Specifies the Object ID of the Application within Azure Active Directory.

optionalClaims.description: A collection of `access_token` or `id_token` blocks as documented below which list the optional claims configured for each token type. For more information see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/develop/active-directory-optional-claims

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getApplication.

appRoles.description: A collection of `app_role` blocks as documented below. For more information https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/architecture/multitenant-identity/app-roles

applicationId.description: the Application ID of the Azure Active Directory Application.

availableToOtherTenants.description: Is this Azure AD Application available to other tenants?

groupMembershipClaims.description: The `groups` claim issued in a user or OAuth 2.0 access token that the app expects.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

identifierUris.description: A list of user-defined URI(s) that uniquely identify a Web application within it's Azure AD tenant, or within a verified custom domain if the application is multi-tenant.

logoutUrl.description: The URL of the logout page.

name.description: The name of the optional claim.

oauth2AllowImplicitFlow.description: Does this Azure AD Application allow OAuth2.0 implicit flow tokens?

owners.description: A list of User Object IDs that are assigned ownership of the application registration.

replyUrls.description: A list of URLs that user tokens are sent to for sign in, or the redirect URIs that OAuth 2.0 authorization codes and access tokens are sent to.

requiredResourceAccesses.description: A collection of `required_resource_access` blocks as documented below.

onlyInitial.description: Set to `true` to only return the initial domain, which is your primary Azure Active Directory tenant domain. Defaults to `false`.

> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,

> please consult the source [`terraform-providers/terraform-provider-azuread` repo](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-azuread/issues).
